userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The materials from Washington and Lee University Special Collections are made available for use in research, teaching, and private study, pursuant to U.S. Copyright law. The user assumes full responsibility for any use of the materials, including but not limited to, infringement of copyright and publication rights of reproduced materials. Any materials used should be fully credited with the source. Permission for publication of this material, in part or in full, must be secured with the Head of Special Collections.

altformavail.head: Existence and Location of Copies
altformavail.p: Some of the materials in this collection are photocopies. The location of the originals in unknown.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p:
Preferred citation: [Identification of item], William Dana Hoyt Correspondence concerning the Committee on Preservation of Goshen Pass, Virginia, WLU Coll. 0305, Special Collections and Archives, James G. Leyburn Library, Washington and Lee University, Lexington, VA
In some cases the citation format may vary. Please contact Special Collections' staff to verify the appropriate format.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection contains photocopies of correspondence concerning the Committee on Preservation of Goshen Pass, Virginia, from January through May 1930 between Hoyt and various people. Also included is a one-page typed history of Goshen Pass and the controversy over a proposed dam there.

controlaccess.subject: Dams -- Environmental aspects
